name: Authentic Pad Thai
ingredients: 1/2 lb medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
steps:
Soak rice noodles in warm water for 30-40 minutes until pliable but not fully soft. Drain and set aside.
Prepare the sauce: whisk together fish sauce, tamarind paste, brown sugar, and rice vinegar until sugar dissolves. Set aside.
Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large wok or skillet over high heat.
Add beaten eggs and scramble quickly until just set. Remove and set aside.
Add another tablespoon of oil to the wok. Add shrimp and cook for 2-3 minutes until pink and opaque. Remove and set aside.
Add remaining oil to the wok. Add minced garlic and sliced shallot, stir-fry for 30 seconds until fragrant.
Add soaked noodles and 2-3 tablespoons of water. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until noodles are tender.
Push noodles to one side, add tofu cubes (if using) and cook for 1 minute.
Pour in the prepared sauce and toss everything together.
Return scrambled eggs and shrimp to the wok.
Add bean sprouts and green onions, toss for 1 minute.
Remove from heat and serve immediately.
Garnish with chopped peanuts, fresh cilantro, and lime wedges on the side.
